text:
The following error is reported in the error log:

[Thu Apr 22 00:28:21 2004] [error] (OS 10045)Operation not supported on socket:
Child -380197: Encountered too many errors accepting client connections.
Possible causes: Unknown. Try using the Win32DisableAcceptEx directive.

This is continually logged and essentially hangs the system on a new install.
Even though I checked the install option for 'single user - manual start',
the installation process starts apache with 250 child processes all reporting
this error.

After adding 'Win32DisableAcceptEx Off', apache is runs ok
creator: willjava@hotmail.com

text: Then it's cool. And it works like expected. Thanks for the info.
creator: nd@perlig.de
slive@apache.org
text:
I was under the impression that AccepEx was automatically disabled for
Win9x-based platforms.  Is that not the case?
Hmm, no. And I see no reason why it should?
creator: nd@perlig.de
slive@apache.org
text:
I could be wrong (since I've never done an inch of windows socket programming),
but I thought that acceptex was not available on win9x.

[Googling...]

Yes, this page
http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/winsock/winsock/acceptex_2.asp
seems to confirm that.  And I thought that windows mpm used to automatically
disable it for win9x.

My apologies, you're right. The Win32DisableAcceptEx thing dropped the automatic
selection. Well...
creator: nd@perlig.de

text: *** Bug 27920 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: slive@apache.org
